Ahhh Gorden you should really try Half-life
A scientist man tries to escape a lab infested with aliens

The original Half Life, a classic

I've never finished before because the end was too hard for me as a kid but now i could and it's great !
The final boss was fun to fight, and i really like the ambiance of it

The level design is well made, sometime you'll have to resolve some "puzzles" to progress in the current level and there's A LOT (at least for me) of hidden monsters so, prepare to be scared at WHATEVER moments ahaha, like, they can just BREAK THE WALL and attack you, or if you're in a vent with no sound but you walking, they'll jump at you in the dark and many others way to make that game more like an horror game than something else x)

I personnally liked that because you're more afraid to be attacked it adds some suspense and stress, especially when you just fought many ennemies and ended up with 10hp and a little bit of ammo, you don't really want to be attacked :)

This is a good game and i recommend playing it, im now playing Opposing Force and Blue Shift to see Half Life 1 with another point of view and understand some things of the story that i maybe didn't when playing this one

I never played this growing up like a good bit of folks on here have, but I thought I'd try it out after hearing so many positive things about it. I was a bit worried before starting that the controls would be clunky or it wouldn't be playable without some sort of mods. It really says alot that this game still holds up to this day! I have never played anything quite like it. For me personally, the controls were simple enough for me to enjoy it but every chapter was such a challenge! I've played fps's before but man, they did something here. Currently playing Half-Life 2 and I can't wait to delve deeper into the franchise!

A classic! 

Inspired generations of first person shooters and a stunning demonstration of how to merge videogames and story telling, i could go on. But i wont i will leave it at that
nihilanth level was a bit tricky, but other than that it is outstanding

---{Graphics}---
Well it's an old game, but after ten to twenty minutes you get used to it.
The 3D models are ok, but the texture are what make so old looking.

---{Gameplay}---
Easy to play if you already played an FPS.
If it's your first FPS, you better play in easy.

---{Game desing}---
Sometimes difficult to understand what to do. (happened 2 or 3 times)
Doesn't tell you explicitely the keys to do certain actions.

---{Audio}---
It's sometimes difficult to understand the dialogues, but the rest is more than ok.

---{Audience}---
Teens or older.

---{PC Requirements}---
As long as you have a graphic card, you're good to go.

---{Difficulity}---
The 3 difficulties are accurate.

---{Grind}---
Depend on the gap between the difficulity and your skill level

---{Story}---
Probably the best thing in this game + the ambiance makes it better.

---{Game Time}---
Took me 11hours in normal mode.

---{Price}---
If you can catch on sell or bundle its relly worth it, otherwise the price is OK.

---{Bugs}---
Won't happen in a normal gameplay.

A classic, really shows how they just let the player roam free in the world without any major arrows pointing to where you need to go. You have to figure it out yourself. Gametime isn't that long, completed it in like 8 hours. Quite an experience.
